section.title: What will Jmol v10 look like?
section.p: Jmol has undergone a number of changes this year. Many of these changes were motivated by the goal of turning Jmol into a viable alternative for the Chime Plug-in. http://www.mdlchime.com
In the spring the RasMol/Chime script compiler and interpreter were written. That code was introduced in Jmol v6.

More recently, the graphics engine has been completely rewritten to provide true 3D rendering capabilities. It is a software implementation designed and optimized for rendering molecules. It does not require any special hardware and will run on most popular browsers with Java support (including those with Java 1.1 JVMs).

These pages demonstrate the pre-release development version of the Jmol applet, combining simple examples of RasMol/Chime script commands with 3D rendering:
atoms
bonds
protein backbones
dotted surfaces

To facilitate conversion of existing web pages built with the Chime plug-in, we have written a perl script which will identify Chime <embed ...> tags and replace them with the appropriate jmol <applet ...> tags. The chime2jmol.pl script handles Chime buttons as well as the Chime applet itself.

This page shows a Chime application that was converted to jmol using the chime2jmol.pl perl script:
